main event: On multiple nights in February 1953, military personnel at Dover Air Force Base observed unidentified objects in the sky, displaying changing colors and unusual movement patterns.
interesting points: The object was observed to change colors from red to white to yellow to green, but in no particular pattern, on consecutive nights.
The objects were reported to be low on the western horizon and appeared to disappear over the horizon after being observed for some time.
Witnesses observed the objects moving gradually from west to northwest with no sound, smoke, or vapor reported.
The sighting was deemed noteworthy enough to request a scramble by the 770th AC&W Squadron, but permission was denied.
Existing weather conditions at the time of the sightings included clear sky, no clouds, and good visibility.
sighted object: Unidentified objects in the sky displaying changing colors
witnesses: Multiple military personnel and a civilian observer
photographs: No photographs included in the report
